user_review: Great selection of crepes both savory and sweet! Be patient the food is made with love and prepared to order. I recommend the Nordique Crepe with smoked salmon. The chef is happy to make substitutions to accommodate your diet and taste.  We got the Nordique with goat cheese instead of the creme frais.

" Bring your own cutlery!! " That's what I was told, not once, but twice when i suggested that they provide real cutlery for those who eat in. Apparently they've had other clientele make the same request often enough, that the management has framed the details of their biodegradable plastic forks and knives. The plastic isn't stopping the line-up of satisfied clients, but a responsive business knows, that if you hear the same request 3x or more, it's wise to consider rather than frame a justification of biodegradable plastics to hold up to customers' face and tell them to bring their own cutlery!! If you eat-in and agree that you'd prefer cutting into your delicious crepe with a real fork and knife - let them know!!!!
Delious crepes. Savory & sweet options and they have a menu with English descriptions. It's small with a long table and seats at the counter.
Got 4 different crepes and they were all amazing! 2 sweet and 2 savory. Definitely recommending this place!
The salted caramel butter crepe was off the chain!!! We ordered 2. Wished we had room for more! Prices are super reasonable too!Enjoy
I've tried many other crêperies in Montreal, and having been to Bretagne, I've always been disappointed. This place, however, is the real deal! Fresh and all fait maison. Delicious!

This place is really close to where I live and I really enjoy it. Every time I try something new, I'm quite pleased. I particularly like the Maele, which is more of a desert crepe. The guy that runs it is also really friendly and fun to talk to.
